hints_html: The labels \(a, b, c\) belong on the x-axis, and \(f(a), f(b), L\) belong on the y-axis.

statement_html: Sketch the graph of a continuous function illustrating the Intermediate Value theorem as stated in part (a). Make sure to include the labels \(a, b, c, f(a), f(b)\) and \(L\).
statement_latex:
Sketch the graph of a continuous function illustrating the Intermediate
Value theorem as stated in part (a). Make sure to include the labels
$a, b, c, f(a), f(b)$ and $L$.
statement_raw: Sketch the graph of a continuous function illustrating the Intermediate Value theorem as stated in part (a).  Make sure to include the labels <math>a, b, c, f(a), f(b)</math> and <math>L</math>.
